selectedVerses.text: We grope for the wall like the blind; we grope like those who have no eyes; we stumble at noon as in the twilight, among those in full vigor we are like dead men.
What could I gain from the strength of their hands, men whose vigor is gone?
Moses was 120 years old when he died. His eye was undimmed, and his vigor unabated.
One dies in his full vigor, being wholly at ease and secure,
His bones are full of his youthful vigor, but it will lie down with him in the dust.
